characteristics_ch1: cell type: M1-polarized HMDM
data_processing: Base calling was done by RTA v1.13.48.0,Sequence reads were aligned to hg19 genome using STAR with default options.,Alignment was filtered using the following specifications: 1) the mapping quality score of each read is â¥ 30, 2) reads from the same pair were mapped to the same chromosome with expected orientations and mapping distance between the read pair was < 500,000 bp, 3) read was uniquely mapped,Fragments Per Kilobase of exon per Million reads mapped (FPKM) was estimated by Cufflinks 2.1.1. Differential expression was tested by Cuffdiff with options "-u --max-bundle-frags 50000000 --library-type fr-firststrand". Annotation from RefSeq genes and the stringent set of lincRNAs from Cabili et al. 2011 was provided.,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: DIFF files were obtained from Cuffdiff output.Tab-delimited text file include normalized FPKM values from HMDM, IPSDM and iPSC samples,HMDM_MAC_M1_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from HMDM and M1-HMDM. sample_1 = HMDM, sample_2 = M1-HMDM,HMDM_MAC_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from HMDM and M2-HMDM. sample_1 = HMDM, sample_2 = M2-HMDM,HMDM_M1_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from M1-HMDM and M2-HMDM. sample_1 = M1-HMDM, sample_2 = M2-HMDM,IPSDM_M1_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from M1-IPSDM and M2-IPSDM. sample_1 = M1-IPSDM, sample_2 = M2-IPSDM,IPSDM_MAC_M1_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from IPSDM and M1-IPSDM. sample_1 = IPSDM, sample_2 = M1-IPSDM,IPSDM_MAC_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from IPSDM and M2-IPSDM. sample_1 = IPSDM, sample_2 = M2-IPSDM,HMDM_IPSDM_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from HMDM and IPSDM. sample_1 = HMDM, sample_2 = IPSDM,iPS_IPSDM_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from iPSC and IPSDM. sample_1 = iPSC, sample_2 = IPSDM,HMDM_IPS_IPSDM.norm.expr.txt contains normalized FPKM from all samples
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA samples were extracted using All Prep DNA/RNA/miRNA Universal Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Extracted RNA samples underwent quality control (QC) assessment using the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA),With a minimum of 300 ng input RNA, we generated first-strand cDNA using random hexamer-primed reverse transcription, followed by second-strand cDNA synthesis using RNase H and DNA polymerase, and ligation of sequencing adapters using the TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). Fragments of ~350 bp were selected by gel electrophoresis. To minimize lane and batch effects in RNA-Seq experiments, barcoded libraries were mixed and pooled in equimolar (2 nmol/L) amounts and diluted to 4 pmol/L for cluster formation on a single flow cell lane, followed by 100 bp paired-end sequencing on Illuminaâs HiSeq 2000.

Annotation from RefSeq genes and the stringent set of lincRNAs from Cabili et al. 2011 was provided.,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: DIFF files were obtained from Cuffdiff output.Tab-delimited text file include normalized FPKM values from HMDM, IPSDM and iPSC samples,HMDM_MAC_M1_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from HMDM and M1-HMDM. sample_1 = HMDM, sample_2 = M1-HMDM,HMDM_MAC_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from HMDM and M2-HMDM. sample_1 = HMDM, sample_2 = M2-HMDM,HMDM_M1_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from M1-HMDM and M2-HMDM. sample_1 = M1-HMDM, sample_2 = M2-HMDM,IPSDM_M1_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from M1-IPSDM and M2-IPSDM. sample_1 = M1-IPSDM, sample_2 = M2-IPSDM,IPSDM_MAC_M1_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from IPSDM and M1-IPSDM. sample_1 = IPSDM, sample_2 = M1-IPSDM,IPSDM_MAC_M2_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from IPSDM and M2-IPSDM. sample_1 = IPSDM, sample_2 = M2-IPSDM,HMDM_IPSDM_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from HMDM and IPSDM. sample_1 = HMDM, sample_2 = IPSDM,iPS_IPSDM_gene_exp.diff contains differential expression result from iPSC and IPSDM. sample_1 = iPSC, sample_2 = IPSDM,HMDM_IPS_IPSDM.norm.expr.txt contains normalized FPKM from all samples
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA samples were extracted using All Prep DNA/RNA/miRNA Universal Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Extracted RNA samples underwent quality control (QC) assessment using the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA),With a minimum of 300 ng input RNA, we generated first-strand cDNA using random hexamer-primed reverse transcription, followed by second-strand cDNA synthesis using RNase H and DNA polymerase, and ligation of sequencing adapters using the TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). Fragments of ~350 bp were selected by gel electrophoresis. To minimize lane and batch effects in RNA-Seq experiments, barcoded libraries were mixed and pooled in equimolar (2 nmol/L) amounts and diluted to 4 pmol/L for cluster formation on a single flow cell lane, followed by 100 bp paired-end sequencing on Illuminaâs HiSeq 2000.

characteristics_ch1: donor id: healthy donor #F70,cell type: monocyte-derived dendritic cells (MDDCs),stimulation: Unstimulated
data_processing: Because of their lower quality, the first and last base of all reads was trimmed, we then used trimmomatic-0.32 to trim by quality, removing 5â or 3â stretches of bases having average quality of less than 20 in a window size 10,Only reads longer than 36 bases were kept for further analysis. After quality trimming reads were aligned to the human ribosomal RNA using Bowtie2 v 2.2.3 with parameters -p 2 -N 1 --no-unal,All reads mapped to rRNA were discarded from further analysis. To estimate gene and isoform expression in Transcripts per Million (TPM) units and raw counts (expected_count), we used RSEM v1.2.28,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tsv, read counts and tpm normalized counts
extract_protocol_ch1: Qiagen RNeasy Miniplus,Nugen Ovation FFPE RNA-seq

characteristics_ch1: donor id: healthy donor #F71,cell type: monocyte-derived dendritic cells (MDDCs),stimulation: Unstimulated
data_processing: Because of their lower quality, the first and last base of all reads was trimmed, we then used trimmomatic-0.32 to trim by quality, removing 5â or 3â stretches of bases having average quality of less than 20 in a window size 10,Only reads longer than 36 bases were kept for further analysis. After quality trimming reads were aligned to the human ribosomal RNA using Bowtie2 v 2.2.3 with parameters -p 2 -N 1 --no-unal,All reads mapped to rRNA were discarded from further analysis. To estimate gene and isoform expression in Transcripts per Million (TPM) units and raw counts (expected_count), we used RSEM v1.2.28,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tsv, read counts and tpm normalized counts
extract_protocol_ch1: Qiagen RNeasy Miniplus,Nugen Ovation FFPE RNA-seq

characteristics_ch1: tissue: peripheral blood,cell type: moDC,treatment: LPS,donor: BC2
data_processing: Illumina Casava1.8 software used for basecalling.,Sequenced reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence, and masked for low-complexity or low-quality sequence, then mapped to hg19 whole genome using HISAT version 0.1.7-beta  with default parameters.,mRNA quantification according to hg19-RefSeq_Transcripts-2015-11-03.,raw read counts were normalized by DE-Seq2.,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include DE-Seq normailzed expression values for each Sample.
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lyzed in TRIzol and RNA was extracted with the miRNeasy kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturesâ protocol. mRNA was purified from 100âng of total RNA using poly-T oligo-attached magnetic beads and the library construction was performed using the Illumina TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit v2.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols
source_name_ch1: Human monocyte isolation from buffy coats

characteristics_ch1: cell type: monocyte-derived dendritic cells,stimulation: 50ng/ml LPS,donor: 2
data_processing: The RNA library was sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform (single read 50bp+7bp index),The single read sequence reads (~7-13 million reads per sample) were mapped against the human genome (NCBI build 37) using Tophat 2.0.6 software.,The readcounts (raw counts) were determined using HTseq-count (Ensemble version 75),To identify statistically relevant differences in mRNA expression the âDESeq2â (v1.4.5) package in R (v3.1) [29] was used and the readcounts obtained from HTseq-count.,The cpm normalization used by DESeq2 is counts per million x size factor, where size factor is computed by library size. These normalized counts were subsequently subjected to a Wald test with a Benjamini-Hochberg (false discovery rate, FDR) correction for multiple testing and additionally yields a log2 fold change for each comparison. Four pairwise comparisons were made: (1) unstimulated moDC vs LPS-stimulated moDC, (2) unstimulated moDC vs C5a-stimulated moDC, (2) LPS-stimulated moDC vs LPS-stimulated moDC plus C5a, and (3) LPS-stimulated moDC vs LPS-stimulated moDC plus C5a in the presence of the MSKII inhibitor.,Genome_build: NCBI build 37,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited rawÂ count matrix
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was harvested using peqGold Trifast reagent (Peqlab, Erlangen, Germany). Illumina TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit was used with 1 ug of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols

characteristics_ch1: cell type: Cord blood CD34+ cell-derived dendritic cell cultures,sorted_gate_identity: Putative cDC2,phenotype: Lineage-HLA-DR+CADM1-BDCA2-CD1c+BTLA-
data_processing: Image analysis and base calling were performed using RTA 2.7.3 and bcl2fastq 2.17.1.14.,Sequenced reads were mapped to human genome hg38 using STAR version 2.2.1 with default parameters except --sjdbOverhang 49 --outSAMstrandField intronMotif --outFilterMultimapNmax 1 (The max number of multiple alignments allowed for a read is 1. If exceeded, the read is considered unmapped).,Read counting was performed using HTSeq-Count (version 0.9.1) with parameters --stranded=no -m union, and using the annotations of human genome hg38 release 87 downloaded from the ENSembl website. In short, our RNA-Seq data has not been made with a strand-specific protocol. When a read was mapped to more than one gene, it was considered as ambiguous and assigned to none of them.,Raw counts were normalized using the Setup fonction of the Seurat package (version 1.4.0.16) with the following parametersÂ : min.cells = 3, do.logNormalize=T, total.expr = 1e6, min.genes=5000, is.expr = 0. We thus selected the cells expressing at least 5000 genes (86), and selected the genes expressed in at least 3 selected cells (18017).,Genome_build: hg38 (GRCh38),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: CAS_Seurat_norm_n3_5000g.txt: Text file with tab delimiters including normalized gene counts for each sample.
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells from cord blood CD34+ hematopoietic progenitor cultures were FACS sorted in 96-well plates (single cell sorted) containing lysis buffer (TCL together with 1% of 2-Mercaptoethanol).,Single cell RNA-sequencing libraries were generated using an adaptation of Smart-Seq2 (Villani et al., Science, 2017) and the Illumina Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit. Full-length RNA-sequencing was performed.

characteristics_ch1: cell type: THP1 derived macrophages,passages: 10- 18,tlr ligands: human TLR1â9 Agonist kit from Invivogen (# tlrl-kit1hw),sample type: LPS THP1
data_processing: RNA-seq data from the HiSeq2000 were processed to generate Fastq files using CASAVA 1.8 and demultiplexed based on the index sequences.,Reads were mapped to the hg19 genome with Gencode 19 annotations using STAR 2.3.1z with the following parameters:--outFilterType BySJout --outFilterMultimapNmax 20 --alignSJoverhangMin 8 --alignSJDBoverhangMin 1--outFilterMismatchNmax 999 --outFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.04 --alignIntronMin 20 --alignIntronMax 1000000 --alignMatesGapMax 1000000 --outSAMstrandField intronMotif.,Genome_build: hg19
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated from the cells using Trizol reagent following standard protocols.,Ribo-depleted RNA was prepared for Illumina sequencing using the NEBNext Ultra RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England BioLabs) following the manufacturerâs recommendation with 15 cycles of PCR. The final libraries were size selected on 2% agarose gels to obtain products with library sizes between 280 and 380 bases in length. The prepared libraries were loaded onto an Illumina HiSeq2000 for single-end 100 base pair reads with 7 base index reads

characteristics_ch1: cell line: THP1 (ATCC TIB-202),cell type: human monocytic cell line,treatment: PMA
data_processing: Sequencing Parameters  Sequencing platform : HiSeq4000  Control Software : HD 3.4.0.38  Primary Analysis RTA : 2.7.7  Type of sequencing : 2 * 100 bases  Index size : 6  Sequencing chemistry : HiSeq 3000/4000 PE,Fastq files were aligned with STAR-2.5.3a with following options (--outSAMstrandField intronMotif --outFilterIntronMotifs RemoveNoncanonical),Bam files were sorted with Samtools 1.6,Gene counts were obtained using HTSeq 0.9.1 htseq-count with union mode,Count normalisation was performed with DESeq2_1.18.1,Genome_build: GRCh38.dna.primary_assembly,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tsv ; gene count
extract_protocol_ch1: NucleoSpin RNA II - Macherey-Nagel,Illumina TruSeq Stranded mRNA

characteristics_ch1: treatment: DMSO_Day2_n1,cell line: THP1
data_processing: Libraries were sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq2500 to in paired-end configuration (101 bp reads).,Reads were trimmed for adapters using Trimmomatic version 0.36 and aligned to the Human Reference Transcriptome (GRCh38) using STAR version 2.4.2a,RSeQC version.2.6.4 was used to remove rRNA features (identified by gencode.v24.annotation.gtf),HTSeq was used to count reads for all genes using the htseq-count version 0.6.0 with intersection strict mode for exon feature type setting (gencode.v24.annotation.gtf).,Feature "ENSG00000202198.1" was removed from the count matrix due to disproportionately high read counts.,Genome_build: GRCh38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: gene expression matrix of samples (columns) by transcript (rows).
extract_protocol_ch1: After treatment, a minimum of 10 million cells were harvested, centrifuged, and resuspended in TRIzol (Invitrogen), then snap frozen on dry ice and stored at -80 degrees C. RNA was purified from cells stored in TRIzol using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen).,Libraries were prepared using TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Library Prep Kit   (Illumina).

characteristics_ch1: cell line/sample: THP1,cell type: monocytic cell line derived from an acute monocytic leukemia patient,treatment: DMSO (vehicle) for 24 hours
data_processing: Paired-end reads were mapped to the human genome (GRCh38 Gencode release 25) with STAR version 2.4.2a with the settings --outFilterMultimapNmax 20, --outFilterType BySJout,  --alignSJoverhangMin 8 and --quantMode GeneCounts using the matching feature annotation GTF file for GRCh38 Gencode release 25. Differential gene expression analysis was performed using DESeq2 version 1.20.0.,Genome_build: GRCh38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include raw read count values per gene for each sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from DMSO or OG86-treated THP1 AML cells using QIAshredder spin columns and an RNeasy Plus Micro Kit (Qiagen, Manchester, UK) and its quality confirmed using an Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA).,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols

characteristics_ch1: cell type: monocyte-derived macrophages,time point: week 3,preservation protocol: DMSO cryopreservation,experiment: human MDMs
data_processing: Reads: Read 1: 20 bp (cell barcode and UMI), Read 2: 50 (sequence read),Raw base BCL files were demultiplexed using bcl2fastq v2.17.1.14 with the parameters â--minimum-trimmed-read-length 20â and â--mask-short-adapter-read 1â. The 50 bp read 2 containing the cDNA sequence was aligned using STAR aligner 2.3.0 against a merged reference of both human hg19 and murine mm10 for the species mixing experiment whereas the reads of MDMs were aligned to the GRCh38 reference genome and annotated according to Ensembl release 86. The STAR genome indices were generated using the parameters â--sjdbOverhang 49â and â--genomeSAsparseD 2â. Drop-seq tools software version 1.12 was then applied to generate a digital expression matrix for each sample.,Genome_build: merged hg19 and mm10 (species mixing), GRCh38 (monocyte-derived macrophages),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include counts per gene for each cell barcode
extract_protocol_ch1: Droplet-based single-cell partitioning using Dolomite BioÂ´s Drop-seq system,Single-cell RNA-Seq libraries were generated using the Drop-seq protocol and Nextera XT DNA sample preparation kit

characteristics_ch1: cell line: THP1,cell type: Monocyte cell culture,treatment: LPS
data_processing: Read trimming were performed by Trimmomatic,Reads obtained were aligned to rererence genome (hg38) using STAR genome aligner (v 2.5.0a),Read counting were preformed by featureCounts (v1.5.0-p1),Genome_build: hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: text files generated by featureCounts: GeneID; count number per gene
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA extraction was performed from 1.5-2Ñ106 cells (THP1 line) with Extract RNA reagent (Evrogen, Russia). The concentration of isolated total RNA was measured with a Qubit Fluorometer (Invitrogen, USA). The quality of RNA was determined with an Agilent BioAnalyzer 2100 using an RNA 600 nano kit (Agilent, USA),Libraries for RNA-seq were prepared using the NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (NEB, USA) according to the manufacturerâs guidelines. Seventy-five bp single-end sequencing was conducted on an Illumina NextSeq 500 platform

characteristics_ch1: cell type: Monocyte derived dendritic cells,donor: Donor 27,prr ligands: LPS
data_processing: Reads were aligned with BWA aln version 0.7.15 with -l 24,Alignments were demultiplexed with a custom script,UMIs were used to collapse reads and make a count table using a custom script,Genome_build: mm10
extract_protocol_ch1: Stimulated DCs were lysed with 30 ÂµL of RLT buffer (Qiagen 79216) containing 1% (v/v) b-mercaptoethanol (VWR 97604-848). Total RNA was isolated using Dynabeads MyOne Silane (Thermo Fisher Scientific 37002D) and RLT buffer. Remaining genomic DNA was removed by on-bead DNase I (Thermo Fisher Scientific AM2239) treatment at 37oC for 20 min. After washing two times with 80% ethanol, total RNA was eluted from beads in nuclease-free water.,Total RNA samples obtained from 1x10^4 mouse BMDCs were reverse transcribed to cDNA by denaturing 10-ÂµL RNA samples with 1 ÂµL containing 2 pmoles of a custom RT primer at 72C for 2 min and snap cooled on ice. A 9-ÂµL RT mix containing 4 ÂµL of 5X RT buffer, 1 ÂµL of 10 mM dNTPs, 2 pmoles of template switching oligo, 0.5 ÂµL Maxima H Minus Reverse Transcriptase (ThermoFisher Scientific EP0753) and 3.5 ÂµL of nuclease-free water was added to the denatured RNA samples, and plates were incubated at 42C for 120 min. Double-stranded cDNA samples were pooled using DNA Clean & Concentrator-5 columns (Zymo Research D4013), and residual RT primers were removed using exonuclease I (New England Biolabs M0293).  Pooled full-length cDNA was amplified with 4-6 cycles of single-primer PCR with the Advantage 2 PCR Kit (Clontech 639206) in a 50-ÂµL reaction volume. Amplified cDNAs were cleaned up with magnetic beads Agencourt AMPure XP (Beckman Coulter A63880) and quantified using the Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity Assay Kit (ThermoFisher Scientific Q32851). 1 ng of cDNA was tagmented and amplified by PCR using Nextera XT Kit (Illumina). Libraries were gel purified using E-Gel EX Agarose Gels, 2% (ThermoFisher Scientific G402002), quantified with the Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity Assay Kit, and sequenced on the NextSeq550 platform (Illumina).

Amplified cDNAs were cleaned up with magnetic beads Agencourt AMPure XP (Beckman Coulter A63880) and quantified using the Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity Assay Kit (ThermoFisher Scientific Q32851). 1 ng of cDNA was tagmented and amplified by PCR using Nextera XT Kit (Illumina). Libraries were gel purified using E-Gel EX Agarose Gels, 2% (ThermoFisher Scientific G402002), quantified with the Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity Assay Kit, and sequenced on the NextSeq550 platform (Illumina).

characteristics_ch1: cell type: Monocyte derived dendritic cells,donor: Donor 45,prr ligands: LPS
data_processing: Reads were aligned with BWA aln version 0.7.15 with -l 24,Alignments were demultiplexed with a custom script,UMIs were used to collapse reads and make a count table using a custom script,Genome_build: mm10
extract_protocol_ch1: Stimulated DCs were lysed with 30 ÂµL of RLT buffer (Qiagen 79216) containing 1% (v/v) b-mercaptoethanol (VWR 97604-848). Total RNA was isolated using Dynabeads MyOne Silane (Thermo Fisher Scientific 37002D) and RLT buffer. Remaining genomic DNA was removed by on-bead DNase I (Thermo Fisher Scientific AM2239) treatment at 37oC for 20 min. After washing two times with 80% ethanol, total RNA was eluted from beads in nuclease-free water.,Total RNA samples obtained from 1x10^4 mouse BMDCs were reverse transcribed to cDNA by denaturing 10-ÂµL RNA samples with 1 ÂµL containing 2 pmoles of a custom RT primer at 72C for 2 min and snap cooled on ice. A 9-ÂµL RT mix containing 4 ÂµL of 5X RT buffer, 1 ÂµL of 10 mM dNTPs, 2 pmoles of template switching oligo, 0.5 ÂµL Maxima H Minus Reverse Transcriptase (ThermoFisher Scientific EP0753) and 3.5 ÂµL of nuclease-free water was added to the denatured RNA samples, and plates were incubated at 42C for 120 min. Double-stranded cDNA samples were pooled using DNA Clean & Concentrator-5 columns (Zymo Research D4013), and residual RT primers were removed using exonuclease I (New England Biolabs M0293).  Pooled full-length cDNA was amplified with 4-6 cycles of single-primer PCR with the Advantage 2 PCR Kit (Clontech 639206) in a 50-ÂµL reaction volume. Amplified cDNAs were cleaned up with magnetic beads Agencourt AMPure XP (Beckman Coulter A63880) and quantified using the Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity Assay Kit (ThermoFisher Scientific Q32851). 1 ng of cDNA was tagmented and amplified by PCR using Nextera XT Kit (Illumina). Libraries were gel purified using E-Gel EX Agarose Gels, 2% (ThermoFisher Scientific G402002), quantified with the Qubit dsDNA High Sensitivity Assay Kit, and sequenced on the NextSeq550 platform (Illumina).

characteristics_ch1: donor: A,cell type: monocyte-derived dendritic cells,stimulation reagent: LPS + IFN-gamma,stimulation time: 4 hrs
data_processing: De-multiplexed raw data was provided by Novogene Corporation, China.,Cutadapt (v1.15) was used to remove sequencing adapters and low quality reads from the de-multiplexed raw data (cutadapt -j 1 -a CTGTCTCTTATACACATCTCCGAGCCCACGAGAC -A CTGTCTCTTATACACATCTGACGCTGCCGACGA --mask-adapter --quality-base=33 --max-n=0.2 -o ....) . STAR (v2.6.0) and RSEM (Li nd Dewey BMC Bioinformatics 2011) were used to map and align the clean reads and perform transcript quantification, respectively.,After mapping transcripts to gene symbols, we obtained a gene count matrix with 17,220 genes and removed the least abundant transcripts for the 31 genes with duplicate gene symbols, resulting in a list of 17,189 genes. To remove low abundance transcripts, the dataset was filtered to only include genes that were present in at least three samples with at least five reads, resulting in a set containing 8,312 genes.,Differentially expressed genes were identified using SAM-seq v3.0 (Li and Tibshirani Stat Mehods 2013) using a two-class paired analysis with 20 resamples and 100 permutations. Pathway gene enrichment analysis was performed using the Reactome Pathway Database (Fabregat et al., Nucleic Acid Research 2018).,Genome_build: GRCh38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include read count matrix, RPKM and TPM values for each sample
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from 4 hrs stimulated cells. Total RNA concentration was measured, checked for quality and used for cDNA preparation by reverse transcription of 5.6 Î¼L of purified RNA. cDNA was amplified using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al., Natue protocols 2014), purified, quantified, and checked for quality and library size.,Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit  (Illumina, FC-131-1096) was used with 1 ng purified cDNA for the construction of swquencing libraries.,cDNA libraries having insert sizes of 500-800 bp were used for paired-end sequencing on the Illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing platform (Novogene Corporation, China).

Total RNA concentration was measured, checked for quality and used for cDNA preparation by reverse transcription of 5.6 Î¼L of purified RNA. cDNA was amplified using Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al., Natue protocols 2014), purified, quantified, and checked for quality and library size.,Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit  (Illumina, FC-131-1096) was used with 1 ng purified cDNA for the construction of swquencing libraries.,cDNA libraries having insert sizes of 500-800 bp were used for paired-end sequencing on the Illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing platform (Novogene Corporation, China).

characteristics_ch1: donor: C,cell type: monocyte-derived dendritic cells,stimulation reagent: LPS + IFN-gamma + PCF,stimulation time: 4 hrs
data_processing: De-multiplexed raw data was provided by Novogene Corporation, China.,Cutadapt (v1.15) was used to remove sequencing adapters and low quality reads from the de-multiplexed raw data (cutadapt -j 1 -a CTGTCTCTTATACACATCTCCGAGCCCACGAGAC -A CTGTCTCTTATACACATCTGACGCTGCCGACGA --mask-adapter --quality-base=33 --max-n=0.2 -o ....) . STAR (v2.6.0) and RSEM (Li nd Dewey BMC Bioinformatics 2011) were used to map and align the clean reads and perform transcript quantification, respectively.,After mapping transcripts to gene symbols, we obtained a gene count matrix with 17,220 genes and removed the least abundant transcripts for the 31 genes with duplicate gene symbols, resulting in a list of 17,189 genes. To remove low abundance transcripts, the dataset was filtered to only include genes that were present in at least three samples with at least five reads, resulting in a set containing 8,312 genes.,Differentially expressed genes were identified using SAM-seq v3.0 (Li and Tibshirani Stat Mehods 2013) using a two-class paired analysis with 20 resamples and 100 permutations. Pathway gene enrichment analysis was performed using the Reactome Pathway Database (Fabregat et al., Nucleic Acid Research 2018).,Genome_build: GRCh38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include read count matrix, RPKM and TPM values for each sample

characteristics_ch1: cell type: monocyte-derived dendritic cells,cultured with: M-CSF, IL-4 and TNF-a,condition: pH 7.3
data_processing: Quality of RNA-seq data was assessed using FastQC.,Reads were pseudo-aligned to the transcriptome using Salmon and transcript expression values were summarized using tximport.,Differential gene expression analysis was performed using DESeq2.,Genome_build: hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Count matrix (raw counts) was obtained using DESeq2.
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lyzed and mRNA extracted using Qiagen RNEasy Mini kit including on-column DNAse digestion.,cDNA was generated with SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Imput RNA Kit for Sequencing (Takara). Multiplexed pair-end libraries 100 nt in length were obtained using Nextera XT kit (Clontech).,Sequencing was performed in the same sequencing unit of NovaSeq (Illumina) (100-nt-length reads, paired end) with an average depth of 15 million reads per sample.

data_processing: Base calling was performed with BCL to FASTQ file converter bcl2fastq v2.17.1.14 from Illumina (https://support.illumina.com/downloads.html).,In order to estimate gene expression levels, paired-end RNASeq reads were mapped to the human genome (hg38) with STAR aligner version 2.5.2a using default mapping parameters (Dobin et al. 2013).,Aligned reads were quality checked with FastQC and MultiQC version 1.7 (Andrews 2010, Ewels 2016).,Numbers of mapped reads for all RefSeq transcript variants of a gene (counts) were combined into a single value by using SAMTOOLS software (Li et al. 2009) and normalized as RPKMs (number of mapped reads per kilobase transcript per million sequenced reads, Mortazavi et al. 2008).,Genome_build: hg38 (GRCh38),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: iPSCderived_myeloid_cells_counts.gct: Read counts in GCT gene expression matrix format.,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: iPSCderived_myeloid_cells_counts.gct: RPKMs in GCT gene expression matrix format.
extract_protocol_ch1: After the polarization period, the cells were lyzed and RNA was extracted using RNeasy Mini Kit from Qiagen. RNA content and purity were determined using Nanodrop. RNA integrity was assessed using Agilent Bioanalyzer. RNA sequencing was performed using the HiSeq4000 sequencing system.,mRNA sequencing libraries were prepared using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA library prep kit (Illumina) according to manufacturer's instructions.

characteristics_ch1: cell type: M1-polarized HMDM,race: Caucasian,Sex: Male,age: 43,disease state: Healthy subject
data_processing: Base calling was done by RTA v1.18,Sequence reads were aligned to hg19 genome using STAR with default options.,Alignment was filtered using the following specifications: 1) reads from the same pair were mapped to the same chromosome with expected orientations and mapping distance between the read pair was < 500,000 bp, 2) read was uniquely mapped,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: macrophage_allele_specific_expression.txt contains allele-specific read counts generated for each ASE SNP in HMDM and M1-polarized HMDM samples.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA samples were extracted using All Prep DNA/RNA/miRNA Universal Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Extracted RNA samples underwent quality control (QC) assessment using the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA),With a minimum of 300 ng input RNA, we generated first-strand cDNA using random hexamer-primed reverse transcription, followed by second-strand cDNA synthesis using RNase H and DNA polymerase, and ligation of sequencing adapters using the TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). Modification of protocol include (1) fragmentation time is decreased from 8 to 6 min to ensure libraries were > 100 bp long and (2) PCR amplification is limited to 12 cycles. To minimize lane and batch effects in RNA-Seq experiments, barcoded libraries were mixed and pooled in equimolar (2 nmol/L) amounts and diluted to 4 pmol/L for cluster formation on a single flow cell lane, followed by 100 bp paired-end sequencing on Illuminaâs HiSeq 2500.

extract_protocol_ch1: RNA samples were extracted using All Prep DNA/RNA/miRNA Universal Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Extracted RNA samples underwent quality control (QC) assessment using the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA),With a minimum of 300 ng input RNA, we generated first-strand cDNA using random hexamer-primed reverse transcription, followed by second-strand cDNA synthesis using RNase H and DNA polymerase, and ligation of sequencing adapters using the TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). Modification of protocol include (1) fragmentation time is decreased from 8 to 6 min to ensure libraries were > 100 bp long and (2) PCR amplification is limited to 12 cycles. To minimize lane and batch effects in RNA-Seq experiments, barcoded libraries were mixed and pooled in equimolar (2 nmol/L) amounts and diluted to 4 pmol/L for cluster formation on a single flow cell lane, followed by 100 bp paired-end sequencing on Illuminaâs HiSeq 2500.

extract_protocol_ch1: RNA samples were extracted using All Prep DNA/RNA/miRNA Universal Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Extracted RNA samples underwent quality control (QC) assessment using the Agilent Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA),With a minimum of 300 ng input RNA, we generated first-strand cDNA using random hexamer-primed reverse transcription, followed by second-strand cDNA synthesis using RNase H and DNA polymerase, and ligation of sequencing adapters using the TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). Modification of protocol include (1) fragmentation time is decreased from 8 to 6 min to ensure libraries were > 100 bp long and (2) PCR amplification is limited to 12 cycles. To minimize lane and batch effects in RNA-Seq experiments, barcoded libraries were mixed and pooled in equimolar (2 nmol/L) amounts and diluted to 4 pmol/L for cluster formation on a single flow cell lane, followed by 100 bp paired-end sequencing on Illuminaâs HiSeq 2500.

characteristics_ch1: sample name: M1-1,cell type: THP1 macrophages
data_processing: Reads alignment was performed using Bowtie 2 (Langmead &  Salzberg, 2012) and significant fold changes accessed with the DE-seq pipeline (Anders & Huber, 2010).,Genome_build: hg19  and NC_011993.1,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Custom interface id, gene name, NCBI ID https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/NC_011993.1, RPKM Condition 1, RPKM condition 2, Fold change (condition 2/condition 1), Deseq  P value,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: gene_id (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/assembly/GCF_000001405.25), gene type, gene name, RPKM Condition 1, RPKM condition 2, Fold change (condition 2/condition 1), Deseq  P value
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA were extracted from THP1 macrophages infected by WT LF82 at 1 h and 6h P.I. Control experiments were performed with macrophages alone and bacteria alone cultivated for 1 h and 6 h in DMEM medium at 37Â°C and 5% CO2 without agitation. RNA extraction was performed as described before (Demarre et al, 2019).,Experiments were performed from biological duplicate. Human rRNAs were depleted using the Ribo-Zero kit, then strand-specific libraries were constructed using the TruSeq Stranded Total RNA kit (Illumina).,Paired-end sequencing (2 x 100 nt) was performed on a HiSeq 2500 sequencer.

characteristics_ch1: cell type/tissue: MDMs,activation: GM-CSF,tissue: Peripheral Blood
data_processing: An average of 55.0 million raw reads were generated per sample (effective rate average 97.6% and Q30 average of 94.5%).,RNA-seq raw reads were trimmed using TrimGalore to remove library adaptors sequences and low-quality reads (QVâ¥30). High-quality reads were mapped to the reference genome (GRCh38/hg38) using STAR, and then the Cufflinks-Cuffdiff (v2.2.1) pipeline was employed to perform transcriptome assembly, normalization and differential expression (DE) analyses.,Genome_build: GRCh38/hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: fpkm_tracking obtained from Cufflinks (file contains the estimated isoform-level expression values in the genericÂ FPKM Tracking Format)
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was obtained by using TRIzol and Phasemaker Tubes (Thermo Fisher Scientific) according to the manufacturers' protocol. RNA quality and quantity were further determined by NanoDrop spectrophotometer and with the Agilent TapeStation (Agilent Technologies).,Library preparation and RNA sequencing (RNA-seq) were performed on an Illumina Novaseq and generating 150bp paired-ended reads (Novogene Bioinformatics Technology Co., LTD).

characteristics_ch1: treatment: LPS,cell type: Monocyte-derived dendritic cells,tissue: Blood PBMCs
data_processing: Samples were prepped with the Illumina TruSeq Stranded mRNA Library Prep Kit.,Resulting DNA libraries were sequenced according to the Illumina TruSeq Rapid v2 protocol. Reads were generated of 50 base-pairs length.,Adapter sequences were trimmed off and the trimmed reads were mapped against the reference using HiSat2 (version 2.1.0).,Gene expression values were called with htseq-count (version 0.11.2).,Genes with at least 30 counts pero million reads in at least one group (min.count = 30) were kept for analysis in edgeR (version 3.26.8), and were considered significantly differentially expressed when adjusted (FDR) P-values < 0.05.,Genome_build: GRCh38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: .txt format files from raw read counts for all genes and samples (non-filtered)
extract_protocol_ch1: With Trizol, followed by a standard RNA isolation protocol,Samples were prepped with the Illumina TruSeq Stranded mRNA Library Prep Kit.

data_processing: Image analysis:: Firecrest (Illumina pipeline 1.9, default parameters),base calling:: Bustard (Illumina pipeline 1.9, default parameters),Quality Control: FastQC,Adapter Trimming: TRIM-GALORE,alignment (RNAseq, chromatin RNA-seq): STAR,tag density files: deepTools package was used to generate BigWiggle files,Genome_build: hg19:,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: strand specific bigWig, compatible with UCSC Genome Browser, were generated using the deepTools package (bamCoverage function, with RPGC [reads per genome coverage] normalization):

characteristics_ch1: cell type: hiPSC-derived macrophages (GM-CSF)
data_processing: Demultiplexing was performed using bcl2fastq v2.20.0.422 from Illumina 356 (https://emea.support.illumina.com/downloads/bcl2fastq-conversion-software-v2-20.html ). Sequencing reads from the RNA-seq experiment were processed with a pipeline building upon the implementation of the ENCODE âLong RNA-seqâ pipeline, also described in (Schlager et al., 2020): filtered reads were mapped against the Homo sapiens (human) genome hg38/GRCh38 (primary 360 assembly, excluding alternate contigs) using the STAR (v2.5.2b) aligner (Dobin et al., 2013) allowing for soft clipping of adapter sequences. For quantification, we used transcript annotation files from Ensembl version 86, which corresponds to GENCODE 25. Gene expression levels were quantified with the above annotations, using RSEM (v1.3.0) (Li and Dewey, 2011) and featureCounts (v1.5.1) (Liao, Smyth and Shi, 2014). Quality controls were implemented using FastQC (v0.11.5) (Andrews, 2015) [Available online at: http://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/ ], picardmetrics (v0.2.4) [ Slowikowski K. (2016): Available online at: https://github.com/slowkow/picardmetrics ] and dupRadar (v1.0.0) (Sayols, Scherzinger and Klein, 2016) at the respective steps.,Genome_build: hg38 (GRCh38),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tpm.txt contains expression levels (tpm) in tab-separated format.
extract_protocol_ch1: One million cells were collected, centrifuged, washed in PBS, and lysed in RLT buffer (79216, Qiagen) before storage at -80C. RNA was later extracted using the Qiagen RNeasy Mini Kit (74104, Qiagen, USA) according to manufacturerâs specifications. An on-column DNA digestion (DNASE10-1SET, Sigma) was performed and the final elution volume was 30 uL. Total RNA was quantitatively and qualitatively assessed using the fluorescence-based Broad Range Quant-iT RNA Assay Kit (Q33140, ThermoFisher) and the Standard Sensitivity RNA Analysis DNF-471 Kit (DNF-471-0500, Agilent) on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent), respectively. Concentrations averaged at 25ng/Î¼L while RIN ranged from 8.2 to 10, with a median of 9.9.,Thirty-three human macrophage- and monocyte-derived RNA samples were normalized on the MicroLab STAR automated liquid platform (Hamilton). Total RNA input of 200ng was used for library construction with the NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina #E7760, together with the NEBNext Poly(A) mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module #E7490 upstream and the NEXNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina #E7600 downstream (all New England Biolabs). The only deviation from the manufacturerâs protocol was the use of Ampure XP beads (Beckman Coulter) for double-stranded cDNA purification, instead of the recommended SPRIselect Beads. mRNA sequencing libraries were quantified by the High Sensitivity dsDNA Quanti-iT Assay Kit (ThermoFisher) on a Synergy HTX (BioTek). Library molarity averaged at 16nM. Final library size distribution was also assessed (smear analysis of ~410bp average and adapter dimer presence <0.5%) by the High Sensitivity Small Fragment DNF-477 Kit on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent). 32 out of 33 sequencing libraries passed quality check and were then normalized on the MicroLab STAR (Hamilton), pooled and spiked in with PhiX Control v3 (Illumina). The library pool was subsequently clustered with the HiSeq 3000/4000 SR Cluster Kit on a cBot; and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 Sequencing System (Illumina) with dual index, single read at 85 bp length (Read parameters: Rd1: 86, Rd2: 8, Rd3: 8), reaching an average depth of 24 million Pass-Filter reads per sample (14.6% CV).

The library pool was subsequently clustered with the HiSeq 3000/4000 SR Cluster Kit on a cBot; and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 Sequencing System (Illumina) with dual index, single read at 85 bp length (Read parameters: Rd1: 86, Rd2: 8, Rd3: 8), reaching an average depth of 24 million Pass-Filter reads per sample (14.6% CV).

characteristics_ch1: cell type: hiPSC-derived macrophages (M-CSF)
data_processing: Demultiplexing was performed using bcl2fastq v2.20.0.422 from Illumina 356 (https://emea.support.illumina.com/downloads/bcl2fastq-conversion-software-v2-20.html ). Sequencing reads from the RNA-seq experiment were processed with a pipeline building upon the implementation of the ENCODE âLong RNA-seqâ pipeline, also described in (Schlager et al., 2020): filtered reads were mapped against the Homo sapiens (human) genome hg38/GRCh38 (primary 360 assembly, excluding alternate contigs) using the STAR (v2.5.2b) aligner (Dobin et al., 2013) allowing for soft clipping of adapter sequences. For quantification, we used transcript annotation files from Ensembl version 86, which corresponds to GENCODE 25. Gene expression levels were quantified with the above annotations, using RSEM (v1.3.0) (Li and Dewey, 2011) and featureCounts (v1.5.1) (Liao, Smyth and Shi, 2014). Quality controls were implemented using FastQC (v0.11.5) (Andrews, 2015) [Available online at: http://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/ ], picardmetrics (v0.2.4) [ Slowikowski K. (2016): Available online at: https://github.com/slowkow/picardmetrics ] and dupRadar (v1.0.0) (Sayols, Scherzinger and Klein, 2016) at the respective steps.,Genome_build: hg38 (GRCh38),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tpm.txt contains expression levels (tpm) in tab-separated format.
extract_protocol_ch1: One million cells were collected, centrifuged, washed in PBS, and lysed in RLT buffer (79216, Qiagen) before storage at -80C. RNA was later extracted using the Qiagen RNeasy Mini Kit (74104, Qiagen, USA) according to manufacturerâs specifications. An on-column DNA digestion (DNASE10-1SET, Sigma) was performed and the final elution volume was 30 uL. Total RNA was quantitatively and qualitatively assessed using the fluorescence-based Broad Range Quant-iT RNA Assay Kit (Q33140, ThermoFisher) and the Standard Sensitivity RNA Analysis DNF-471 Kit (DNF-471-0500, Agilent) on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent), respectively. Concentrations averaged at 25ng/Î¼L while RIN ranged from 8.2 to 10, with a median of 9.9.,Thirty-three human macrophage- and monocyte-derived RNA samples were normalized on the MicroLab STAR automated liquid platform (Hamilton). Total RNA input of 200ng was used for library construction with the NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina #E7760, together with the NEBNext Poly(A) mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module #E7490 upstream and the NEXNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina #E7600 downstream (all New England Biolabs). The only deviation from the manufacturerâs protocol was the use of Ampure XP beads (Beckman Coulter) for double-stranded cDNA purification, instead of the recommended SPRIselect Beads. mRNA sequencing libraries were quantified by the High Sensitivity dsDNA Quanti-iT Assay Kit (ThermoFisher) on a Synergy HTX (BioTek). Library molarity averaged at 16nM. Final library size distribution was also assessed (smear analysis of ~410bp average and adapter dimer presence <0.5%) by the High Sensitivity Small Fragment DNF-477 Kit on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent). 32 out of 33 sequencing libraries passed quality check and were then normalized on the MicroLab STAR (Hamilton), pooled and spiked in with PhiX Control v3 (Illumina). The library pool was subsequently clustered with the HiSeq 3000/4000 SR Cluster Kit on a cBot; and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 Sequencing System (Illumina) with dual index, single read at 85 bp length (Read parameters: Rd1: 86, Rd2: 8, Rd3: 8), reaching an average depth of 24 million Pass-Filter reads per sample (14.6% CV).

characteristics_ch1: cell line: THP1,treatment: 50 ng/ml PMA, 48 h,cell type: THP1-derived macrophages,sirna: 200 nM NC siRNA, 48 h,stimulation: 200 ng/ml LPS, 3 h
data_processing: Illumina Casava software was used for basecalling.,Cutadapt software was used for data filtering. Data filtering steps required at least 10 bp Overlap, and 20% base false rate was permitted.,HISAT2 software (http://ccb.jhu.edu/software/hisat2/index.shtml), with the parameter of microexon-search and library-type=fr-firststrand, was used for reads alignment.,Genome_build: GRCh38.98,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Processed_Data_Matrix.xlsx includes raw gene counts and FPKM values for every gene and every sample.
extract_protocol_ch1: 1 Î¼g of total RNA was enriched for the Poly-A mRNA and reverse transcribed to double-stranded cDNA. The cDNA was end repaired, adenylated, and ligated with Illumina indexes to construct cDNA library which was paired-end (PE) sequenced using Illumina sequencing platforms based on Next-Generation Sequencing.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols.

characteristics_ch1: cell line: U937 histiocytic lymphoma,treatment: 6h PMA,tissue: Blood,cell type: Monocyte/macrophage
data_processing: Raw data obtained from the sequencing reaction was pre-processed using DPAC which includes a fastp and cutadapt trimming steps to remove sequencing adaptors and poly(A)-tails (Routh, G3, 2017),Processed Data were aligned to hg19 using HISAT2 (Kim et al, Nature Methods, 2015),Differential gene expression analysis was performed using DESeq2 (Love et al, Genome Biology 2014),Alternative polyadenylation analysis was performed using DPAC (Routh, G3, 2019),Genome_build: hg19
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA extraction was carried out on 5x106 cells treated with PMA for 6 and 24 hours using TRIzol according to manufacturerâs protocol.,Reverse-transcription with oligo-dT primer (unanchored) supplemented with small amounts of 3â-azido-nucleotides (AzVTPs) was done to initiate cDNA synthesis from within the poly(A) tail ensuring stochastic termination upstream of the poly(A) tail. Resulting 3'-azido-blocked cDNA molecules were purified, âclick-ligatedâÂ and amplified to generate a cDNA sequencing library. These libraries were pooled and sequenced using the manufacturerâs standard operating procedures on a NextSeq 550 obtaining 1Ã150 bp (130M) single-end reads.,Poly(A)-ClickSeq

characteristics_ch1: tissue: Human blood,source cell type: Human blood primary monocyte,derived cell type: monocyte-derived Dendritic cells,treatment: IL-4/GM-CSF 5-7 days,donor: 1
data_processing: RNA-seq libraries were sequenced on an Illumina HiSeq 2500 machine with base calling by CASAVA software version 1.8.2.,Trimmomatic software (version 0.33) was used to trim raw single-ended reads which were then aligned to human genome (hg19 / GRC37, UCSC) using Bowtie (version 2.2.5).,TopHat (version 2.0.14) was used to analyse the mapping results and identify splice junctions between exons,The mapped reads counting was performed with Cufï¬inks (version 2.2.1) and reported as âfragments per kilobase of transcript per million fragments mappedâ or FPKM.,The Cuffmerge option from Cufflinks program was used to merge identified transcript pieces to full length  transcripts and to annotate the transcripts accordingly.,Merged transcripts  from two or more samples / conditions were compared using Cuffdiff to determine the differential expression  levels at transcript and gene level including a measure of significance between samples / conditions,Genome_build: Human Genome hg19 / GRC37, UCSC. Annotation reference: Gencode v19, Ensembl 75,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each condition
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from 4x10^6 human monocyte-derived cells (MoDC, MoLC and MoDC+TGF-b) with TRIzol-chloroform (Invitrogen) precipitation, according to manufacturerâs recommendation, and cleaned up with RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen).,mRNA were enriched by poly-A purification, then fragmented and reverse transcribed. Adapters were ligated to random primed cDNA and adapter-specific PCR amplification was performed. Samples were barcoded and size selected to generate 50 base-pair single-end read cDNA libraries for Illumina sequencing

data_processing: Illumina software bcl2fastq-v2.19.0 used for base calling,Raw RNA sequences were trimmed (Cutadapt v 1.18) and aligned against the human reference genomeÂ GRChg19Â using STAR (v 2.7.5a),featureCounts (v. 2.0.1) was used to determine the total counts of transcripts per gene,Differential gene expression and clustering were performed in the R statistical environment using the DESeq2 package,Genome_build: hg19,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: deseq2IDC_DC10.csv:  Deseq2 IDC vs DC10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: deseq2DC10CH_DC10.csv:  Deseq2 DC10CH vs DC10

characteristics_ch1: treatment: MCSF_IL4_IL13_TNFa_NTB,culture conditions: SiCu_MDM
data_processing: Basecalling has been done with bcl2fastq v2.20.0.422.,Alignment has been performed with STAR v2.5.2 using hg38 genome reference.,Read counts has been obtained with featureCounts v1.5.1.,Demultiplexing was performed using bcl2fastq v2.20.0.422 from Illumina (https://emea.support.illumina.com/downloads/bcl2fastq-conversion-software-v2-20.html).  Sequencing reads from the RNA-seq experiment were processed with a pipeline building upon the implementation of the ENCODE âLong RNA-seqâ pipeline (also described in (Schlager et al., 2020)): filtered reads were mapped against the Homo sapiens (human) genome hg38/GRCh38 (primary assembly, excluding alternate contigs) using the STAR (v2.5.2b) aligner (Dobin et al., 2013) allowing for soft clipping of adapter sequences.   For quantification, we used transcript annotation files from Ensembl version 86, which corresponds to GENCODE 25 for human. Gene expression levels were quantified with the above annotations, using RSEM (v1.3.0) (Li and Dewey, 2011) and featureCounts (v1.5.1) (Liao, Smyth and Shi, 2014). Quality controls were implemented using FastQC (v0.11.5) [ Andrews, S. (2010). FastQC:  A Quality Control Tool for High Throughput Sequence Data [Online]. Available online at: http://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/ ], picardmetrics (v0.2.4) [ Slowikowski K. (2016): Available online at: https://github.com/slowkow/picardmetrics ] and dupRadar (v1.0.0) (Sayols, Scherzinger and Klein, 2016) at the respective steps.,Genome_build: ENSEMBL hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Matrix table with raw gene counts for every gene and every sample
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated isolation using MagMax (biosystems #AM1830) following the manufactures procedure. Final elution 50uL. Total RNA was quantitatively and qualitatively assessed using the fluorescence-based Broad Range Quant-iT RNA Assay Kit (ThermoFisher) and the Standard Sensitivity RNA Analysis DNF-471 Kit on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent), respectively.,RNA samples were normalized on the MicroLab STAR automated liquid platform (Hamilton). At total RNA input of 250ng was used for library construction with the NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina #E7760, together with the NEBNext Poly(A) mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module #E7490 upstream and the NEXNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina #E7600 downstream (all New England Biolabs). The only deviation from the manufacturerâs protocol was the use of Ampure XP beads (Beckman Coulter) for double-stranded cDNA purification, instead of the recommended SPRIselect Beads. Final sequencing libraries were quantified by the High Sensitivity dsDNA Quanti-iT Assay Kit (ThermoFisher) on a Synergy HTX (BioTek). mRNA libraries were also assessed for size distribution and adapter dimer presence (<0.5%) by the High Sensitivity Small Fragment DNF-477 Kit on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent). All sequencing libraries were then normalized on the MicroLab STAR (Hamilton), pooled and spiked in with PhiX Control v3 (Illumina).

Total RNA was quantitatively and qualitatively assessed using the fluorescence-based Broad Range Quant-iT RNA Assay Kit (ThermoFisher) and the Standard Sensitivity RNA Analysis DNF-471 Kit on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent), respectively.,RNA samples were normalized on the MicroLab STAR automated liquid platform (Hamilton). At total RNA input of 250ng was used for library construction with the NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina #E7760, together with the NEBNext Poly(A) mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module #E7490 upstream and the NEXNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina #E7600 downstream (all New England Biolabs). The only deviation from the manufacturerâs protocol was the use of Ampure XP beads (Beckman Coulter) for double-stranded cDNA purification, instead of the recommended SPRIselect Beads. Final sequencing libraries were quantified by the High Sensitivity dsDNA Quanti-iT Assay Kit (ThermoFisher) on a Synergy HTX (BioTek). mRNA libraries were also assessed for size distribution and adapter dimer presence (<0.5%) by the High Sensitivity Small Fragment DNF-477 Kit on a 48-channel Fragment Analyzer (Agilent). All sequencing libraries were then normalized on the MicroLab STAR (Hamilton), pooled and spiked in with PhiX Control v3 (Illumina).

characteristics_ch1: treatment: MCSF_IL4_IL13_TNFa,culture conditions: SiCu_MDM
data_processing: Basecalling has been done with bcl2fastq v2.20.0.422.,Alignment has been performed with STAR v2.5.2 using hg38 genome reference.,Read counts has been obtained with featureCounts v1.5.1.,Demultiplexing was performed using bcl2fastq v2.20.0.422 from Illumina (https://emea.support.illumina.com/downloads/bcl2fastq-conversion-software-v2-20.html).  Sequencing reads from the RNA-seq experiment were processed with a pipeline building upon the implementation of the ENCODE âLong RNA-seqâ pipeline (also described in (Schlager et al., 2020)): filtered reads were mapped against the Homo sapiens (human) genome hg38/GRCh38 (primary assembly, excluding alternate contigs) using the STAR (v2.5.2b) aligner (Dobin et al., 2013) allowing for soft clipping of adapter sequences.   For quantification, we used transcript annotation files from Ensembl version 86, which corresponds to GENCODE 25 for human. Gene expression levels were quantified with the above annotations, using RSEM (v1.3.0) (Li and Dewey, 2011) and featureCounts (v1.5.1) (Liao, Smyth and Shi, 2014). Quality controls were implemented using FastQC (v0.11.5) [ Andrews, S. (2010). FastQC:  A Quality Control Tool for High Throughput Sequence Data [Online]. Available online at: http://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/ ], picardmetrics (v0.2.4) [ Slowikowski K. (2016): Available online at: https://github.com/slowkow/picardmetrics ] and dupRadar (v1.0.0) (Sayols, Scherzinger and Klein, 2016) at the respective steps.,Genome_build: ENSEMBL hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Matrix table with raw gene counts for every gene and every sample

characteristics_ch1: treatment: DCVC_LPS
data_processing: Raw fastq files were first examined using fastQC (version 0.11.5) (Andrews 2010), and reports generated for all 24 samples were collated using multiQC (version 0.9),Mapped reads to the human reference genome (hg38) were done using the Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference (STAR) (version 2.6.0c),Following mapping, featureCounts (version 1.6.1) was used to quantify aligned reads mapping to exons.,Quantification output from featureCounts was read into R (version 3.6.0), and analyzed with the DESeq2 package (version 1.24.0),Genome_build: hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: matrix of normalized counts for each gene and sample
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from THP-1 cells  using the Quick-RNA MiniPrep kit and standard protocol (Zymo Research).,RNA library preparation was performed using poly-A selection.

data_processing: Raw reads were trimmed to remove Truseq adapters and bases from the 3â end with quality scores less than 20 using cutadapt (Martin, 2011); trimmed reads shorter than 40bp were be discarded. ENSEMBL gene expression were quantified  FeatureCounts (Liao et al., 2014).,Genome_build: hg38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab-delimited text of gene expression: unnormalized counts

characteristics_ch1: cell type: monocyte derived DCs,treatment: LPS control
data_processing: Trimming of low-quality sequences and adapter content has been performed with cutadapt v. 2.4, with the following parameters: --error-rate 0.1 --quality-cutoff 20 --minimum-length 10.,The alignment of reads to the GRCh38 human reference genome has been performed using STAR v. 2.7.7a with the following options: -outFilterType BySJout --outFilterMultimapNmax 20 --alignSJoverhangMin 8 --alignSJDBoverhangMin 1 --outFilterMismatchNmax 999 --outFilterMismatchNoverReadLmax 0.04 --alignIntronMin 20 --alignIntronMax 1000000 --alignMatesGapMax 1000000.,The duplicate alignments have been flagged by the MarkDuplicates program from the Picard v.2.24.0 software suite.,The alignment filtering was performed with the samtools v. 1.10 software, with the following parameters: -q 1 -f3 -F1280.,The read quantification has been performed per exon on gene level using htseq-count script from the HTSeq v. 0.13.5 python package, using Ensembl GRCh38 version 102 genome annotation.,Differential expression analysis has been performed in R programming language v. 4.0.3 with DESeq2 v. 1.30.0 R package.,Genome_build: GRCh38,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: HTSeq counts.tsv files were generated with htseq-count script, they contain counts for each gene for each sample in tab-delimited format; pbmcs_deseq2_results.annotated.counts.wide.csv file contains DESeq2 differential expression results statistics together with library-size normalized expression counts for each sample, annotated with gene name and description in comma-delimited format.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated with an RNA purification kit (Marcherey-Nagel) and was subjected to poly(A) enrichment using NEBNext Poly(A) mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module (New England Biolabs).,Strand-specific cDNA libraries were constructed with NEBNextÂ® Ultraâ¢ II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for IlluminaÂ® (New England Biolabs). Sequencing was performed using NovaSeq6000 (Illumina) sequencer in PE150 mode.

characteristics_ch1: tissue: PBMC,cell.type: Dendritic cells,disease.status: healthy,vendor: All Cells,extract.protocol: NPB-Monocyte Derived Myeloid Dendritic Cells (MoDC) are derived from highly purified monocytes. For seven days, the highly purified monocytes are cultured with 10% Fetal Bovine Serum in the presence of GM-CSF and IL-4. These cells express the following markers: CD11c, CD40, and CD86. These cells lack the expression of CD14.,group: Purified Cell
data_processing: Estimated transcript read counts and transcripts per million (tpm) were generated via pseudo-alignment with Kallisto v0.46.0 using Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.cdna.all.idx.,A translation table of Ensembl transcript ID to Ensembl gene ID and gene symbol was derived using biomaRt and stored on the Synapse platform at syn21574276.,Estimated gene read counts and counts per million were calculated as the sum of transcript counts and tpms, respectively, associated with the gene via the translation table.,Assembly: hg38,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with Kallisto-estimated counts for every Ensembl transcript ID and every sample,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with Kallisto-estimated tpms for every Ensembl transcript ID and every sample,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with Kallisto-estimated counts for every Ensembl gene ID and every sample,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with Kallisto-estimated cpms for every Ensembl gene ID and every sample,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with Kallisto-estimated counts for every gene symbol and every sample,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with Kallisto-estimated cpms for every gene symbol and every sample
extract_protocol_ch1: We generated in vitro and in silico admixtures of tumor, immune, and stromal cells and sequenced them along with the purified populations from which they were derived. We used the admixtures as ground truth in a community-wide DREAM Challenge aimed at providing an objective, unbiased assessment of published deconvolution methods and at promoting development of new approaches.

characteristics_ch1: tissue: PBMC,cell.type: Macrophages,disease.status: healthy,vendor: Stem Express,vendor.id: PBMAC001.5C,extract.protocol: The isolation of mature macrophages from tissue can be difficult, therefore the use of monocyte-derived macrophages (MDM) for functional studies is a very attractive alternative. Non-monocytes are depleted from the mononuclear cell population using immunomagnetic particles leaving purified, untouched CD14+ monocytes. The untouched monocytes are cultured for 4-5 days with 10% FBS in the presence of M-CSF and IL-4. After culture, cells are checked for the expression of CD11b, CD18, CD68, and HLA-DR by flow cytometry.,group: Purified Cell

characteristics_ch1: cell type: Monocyte-derived dendritic cells,donor number: M27,genotype: control,infection: Mock,time: 0h
data_processing: Reads were aligned to human genome assembly hg38  (Gencode v34 transcript set) and gene expression was quantified via RSEM (v1.3.1) software's rsem-calculate-expression command, utilizing STAR aligner (v2.6.1)  with default parameters to create the "expected gene counts" files.,Reads were aligned to human genome assembly hg38  (Gencode v34 transcript set) concatenated to HIV genome plasmid (pUC57mini_NLBN_dEnv_GFP) and human and HIV genes were quantified via RSEM (v1.3.1) software's rsem-calculate-expression command, utilizing STAR aligner (v2.6.1)  with default parameters to create the "expected gene counts" files.,Assembly: hg38,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with raw (expected) gene counts for every gene and every sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lysed and RNA from these samples was isolated by using Rneasy Plus Mini kit (Qiagen) following manufacturer's protocol.,Poly(A)-selected RNA-seq libraries were generated by Genewiz, using standard Illumina protocol.

data_processing: Reads were aligned to human genome assembly hg38  (Gencode v34 transcript set) and gene expression was quantified via RSEM (v1.3.1) software's rsem-calculate-expression command, utilizing STAR aligner (v2.6.1)  with default parameters to create the "expected gene counts" files.,Reads were aligned to human genome assembly hg38  (Gencode v34 transcript set) concatenated to HIV genome plasmid (pUC57mini_NLBN_dEnv_GFP) and human and HIV genes were quantified via RSEM (v1.3.1) software's rsem-calculate-expression command, utilizing STAR aligner (v2.6.1)  with default parameters to create the "expected gene counts" files.,Assembly: hg38,Supplementary files format and content: Matrix table with raw (expected) gene counts for every gene and every sample

characteristics_ch1: treatment: 0 hr LPS/IFNg,cell line: THP1 monocytes (differentiated to macropahges)
data_processing: Adapters and low-quality reads were trimmed from paired-end reads using Trim Galore! (version 0.4.3),Salmon was used in quant mode to quantify reads to hg19 transcripts (version 1.4.0),Reads were aligned to the hg19 genome using HISAT2 (version 2.1.0),Alignments were indexed using samtools (version 1.9),Replicates were merged with samtools (version 1.9),Alignments were converted to bigwigs using deeptools (version 3.0.1),Reads were summarized to a gene level using txImport (R version 3.3.1, tximport version 1.2.0),Differential analysis was completed in DESeq2 (R version 3.3.1, DESeq version 1.33.5),Assembly: hg19,Supplementary files format and content: quant.sf: tab-delimited file of transcript-level quantifications including transcript ID, length, effective length, TPM, and NumReads, output from Salmon; .bw: bigwig files of signal tracks; .tsv: tab-delimited text file containing information on gene-summarized information including chromosome, start and end coordinates, ENSEMBL and HGNC IDs, differential cluster, DESeq adjusted LRT p-values and LFC, raw counts, variance-stabilize transformed counts, and Z-scored VST counts
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted using the QIAGEN RNeasy Mini kit. With Dnase I treatment. RNA integrity numbers were confirmed using a Tapestation High-Sensitivity RNA tape (<9.8). Concentration was determined using a Qubit HS assay.,Ribosomal RNA was removed using the NEB rRNA Depletion Kit (Human/Mouse/Rat) using 500 ng of RNA as input. Following depletion, RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the NEB Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina, and NEBNext Multiplex Oligos for Illumina. Library concentration and fragment size was determined using Qubit (dsDNA HS assay) and Tapestation (D1000 tape). Libraries from each time point were pooled to a final DNA concentration of 15 nM, and 75-bp paired-end reads were sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq 500 using a High Output Kit.

Libraries from each time point were pooled to a final DNA concentration of 15 nM, and 75-bp paired-end reads were sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq 500 using a High Output Kit.

data_processing: Sequence read quality was assessed by means of the FastQC methods and Trimmomatic was used to trim the Illumina adapters containing, poor-quality bases and ambiguous nucleotide-containing sequences.,High-quality reads were used to align against the Genome Reference Consortium human genome build 38 (GRCh38). extract_protocol_ch1: RNeasy mini kits (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to the manufacturerâs instructions. characteristics_ch1: cell type: iPSC-derived macrophages,disease state: IRF1 patient,stimulation: IFNg,treatment dose: 1,000 U/mL,stimulation duration: 2 hours
data_processing: The RNA-seq fastq files were first inspected with FastQC (https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/) to ensure that the raw data were of high quality.,For each subject, the two fastq files generated were then mapped to the human reference genome (Ensembl GRCh37 release 75) with STAR v.2.7.3a in the two-pass mode,The mapping quality of each bam file was then evaluated with RSeQC,Reads were quantified to generate gene-level feature counts from the read mapping, with HTSeq-count v.0.11.2,Assembly: Ensembl GRCh37 release 75,Supplementary files format and content: Raw counts were obtained using HTSeq-count v.0.11.2
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from primary fibroblasts from patients or healthy controls with the the miRNeasy Mini Kit (Zimo), and treated with DNAse (Zymo) to remove residual genomic DNA. Quality controls were performed and all RNA samples were of good quality (RIN>8).,RNA-Seq libraries were prepared with the Illumina RiboZero TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina) and sequenced on the Illumina NextSeq platform in the 150-nt (for monocyte-derived and iPSC-derived macrophages) or 100-nt (for primary fibroblasts), paired-end configuration.

characteristics_ch1: cell type: iPSC-derived macrophages,disease state: IRF1 patient,stimulation: IFNg,treatment dose: 1,000 U/mL,stimulation duration: 8 hours
data_processing: The RNA-seq fastq files were first inspected with FastQC (https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/) to ensure that the raw data were of high quality.,For each subject, the two fastq files generated were then mapped to the human reference genome (Ensembl GRCh37 release 75) with STAR v.2.7.3a in the two-pass mode,The mapping quality of each bam file was then evaluated with RSeQC,Reads were quantified to generate gene-level feature counts from the read mapping, with HTSeq-count v.0.11.2,Assembly: Ensembl GRCh37 release 75,Supplementary files format and content: Raw counts were obtained using HTSeq-count v.0.11.2
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from primary fibroblasts from patients or healthy controls with the the miRNeasy Mini Kit (Zimo), and treated with DNAse (Zymo) to remove residual genomic DNA. Quality controls were performed and all RNA samples were of good quality (RIN>8).,RNA-Seq libraries were prepared with the Illumina RiboZero TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina) and sequenced on the Illumina NextSeq platform in the 150-nt (for monocyte-derived and iPSC-derived macrophages) or 100-nt (for primary fibroblasts), paired-end configuration.

characteristics_ch1: cell type: primary monocyte-derived dendritic cells,cell source: primary cells,treatment: IL-4 and GM-CSF
data_processing: Data processing was performed by Novogene.,Raw data (raw reads) of FASTQ format were firstly processed through fastp. In this step, clean data (clean reads) were obtained by removing reads containing adapter and poly-N sequences and reads with low quality from raw data.,Reference genome and gene model annotation files were downloaded from genome website browser (NCBI/UCSC/Ensembl) directly. Paired-end clean reads were aligned to the reference genome using the Spliced Transcripts Alignment to a Reference (STAR) software, which is based on a previously undescribed RNA-seq alignment algorithm that uses sequential maximum mappable seed search in uncompressed suffix arrays followed by seed clustering and stitching procedure. STAR exhibits better alignment precision and sensitivity than other RNA-seq aligners for both experimental and simulated data.,FeatureCounts was used to count the read numbers mapped of each gene. And then RPKM of each gene was calculated based on the length of the gene and reads count mapped to this gene. RPKM, Reads Per Kilobase of exon model per Million mapped reads, considers the effect of sequencing depth and gene length for the reads count at the same time, and is currently the most commonly used method for estimating gene expression levels (Mortazavi et al., 2008).,Differential expression analysis between two conditions/groups (three biological replicates per condition) was performed using DESeq2 R package. DESeq2 provides statistical routines for determining differential expression in digital gene expression data using a model based on the negative binomial distribution. The resulting P values were adjusted using the Benjamini and Hochbergâs approach for controlling the False Discovery Rate (FDR). Genes with an adjusted P value < 0.05 found by DESeq2 were assigned as differentially expressed.,Assembly: GRCh38.p12 (hg38),Supplementary files format and content: iMonovspMono.DEG.txt - Tab delimmited file including read count, fpkm, and differential expression analysis,Supplementary files format and content: imoDCvspmoDC.DEG.txt - Tab delimmited file including read count, fpkm, and differential expression analysis,Supplementary files format and content: iMDMvspMDM.DEG.txt - Tab delimmited file including read count, fpkm, and differential expression analysis
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was purified using the QIAGEN Rneasy mini plus kit,1Î¼g of total RNA/sample was used for input and libraries were constructed using NEBNextÂ® Ultra TM RNA Library Prep Kit for IlluminaÂ®

characteristics_ch1: time point: 6h,agent: DMSO,cell line: THP1
data_processing: Reads were aligned to the human genome (GRCh38 GENCODE release 25) and gene annotated with their corresponding GTF file (GENCODE GRCh38 release 25) using STAR version 2.4.2a with the settings --outFilterMultimapNmax 20 ,--outFilterType BySJout, --alignSJoverhangMin 8, --quantMode GeneCounts (Dobin A, et al. STAR: ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner.Â Bioinformatics. 2013;29(1):15â21). DEseq2 was used to perform differential gene expression analysis and calculate FPKM (fragments per kilobase of transcript per million mapped reads) values for each gene (Love et al., 2014).,Assembly: GRCh38
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from THP1 cells treated with either DMSO or CCS1477 using the RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (Qiagen, 74134), according to manufacturerâs instructions. RNA quality was analyzed using the Agilent Bioanalyzer.,Libraries were prepared using the Agilent Sureselect pA. Then, libraries were sequenced using the Novaseq SP sequencing system (Illumina) with 30 million reads per sample.

characteristics_ch1: time point: 6h,agent: DMSO,cell line: THP1
data_processing: Reads were aligned to the human genome (GRCh38 GENCODE release 25) and gene annotated with their corresponding GTF file (GENCODE GRCh38 release 25) using STAR version 2.4.2a with the settings --outFilterMultimapNmax 20 ,--outFilterType BySJout, --alignSJoverhangMin 8, --quantMode GeneCounts (Dobin A, et al. STAR: ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner.Â Bioinformatics. 2013;29(1):15â21). DEseq2 was used to perform differential gene expression analysis and calculate FPKM (fragments per kilobase of transcript per million mapped reads) values for each gene (Love et al., 2014).,Assembly: GRCh38
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from THP1 cells treated with either DMSO or CCS1477 using the RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (Qiagen, 74134), according to manufacturerâs instructions. RNA quality was analyzed using the Agilent Bioanalyzer.,Libraries were prepared using the Agilent Sureselect pA. Then, libraries were sequenced using the Novaseq SP sequencing system (Illumina) with 30 million reads per sample.

data_processing: The Skewer software was used for dynamically remove the joint sequence and poor-quality fragment.,The STAR software was used to compare the preprocessed sequence with the reference genome sequence of the sequenced species.,The StringTie software was used to count the original sequence of known genes, and FPKM (Fragments Per Kilobase of transcript per Million fragments mapped) was used to calculate the expression.,Using DESeq2 software to screen differently expressed genes between two groups according to the experimental design,Assembly: mm10 or hg38,Supplementary files format and content: h_RFX1_RNA-seq worksheet: counts for RNA-seq of ontrol and Rfx1-overexpressed hMDMs,Supplementary files format and content: m_Rfx1_RNA-seq worksheet:counts.txt for RNA-seq of ontrol and Rfx1-overexpressed PMAs,Supplementary files format and content: m_CKO_RNA-seq worksheet:counts.txt for RNA-seq of WT and CKO PMAs

characteristics_ch1: cell line: THP1,cell type: monocyte cell line,genotype: wild type,treatment: 1000U sIFN(I:C), 3 hours
data_processing: quantify abundances of transcripts from RNA-Seq data using kallisto (0.43.0) with parameter --rf-stranded. transcript sequences were downloaded form gencode (Release 25),Assembly: hg38,Supplementary files format and content: tab-delimited text files include estimated counts and TPM values for each sample
extract_protocol_ch1: After extracting the total RNA from samples, mRNA and non-coding RNAs are enriched by removing rRNA form the total RNA with kit.,By using the fragmentation buffer, the mRNA and non-coding RNAs are fragmented into short fragments (about 200~700 bp), then the first-strand cDNA is synthesized by random hexamer-primer using the fragments as templates. Buffer, dNTPs, RNase H and DNA polymerase I are added to synthesize the second strand cDNA. The double strand cDNA is purified with QiaQuick PCR extraction kit and then used for end-polishing. Sequencing adapters are ligated to the fragments , then the second strand is degraded using UNG(Uracil-N-Glyosylase)finally. The fragments are purified by Agarose gel electrophoresis and enriched by PCR amplification.,lncRNA (including mRNA)

characteristics_ch1: tissue: human peripheral blood,cell line: THP1,cell type: human monocytic leukemia,genotype: WT,treatment: PMA induction
data_processing: The image data measured by the high-throughput sequencer are convertedintosequence data (reads) by CASAVA base recognition,Index of the reference genome was built using Hisat2(v2.0.5) and paired-end clean reads were aligned to the reference genome usingHisat2 (v2.0.5).,featureCounts (v1.5.0-p3) was used to count the reads numbers mapped to eachgene. And then FPKM of each gene was calculated based on the length of the geneand reads count mapped to this gene,Supplementary files format and content: tab-delimited text files include RPKM values for each Sample

characteristics_ch1: tissue: blood,cell type: monocyte-derived macrophages (MDMs),genotype: diploid female,treatment: vehicle 2 h
data_processing: Reads were mapped using salmon 1.3.0 in the quant mode with the options i ,l, SF, validateMappings and noLengthCorrection. A custom index was used to discriminate between human, Drosophila, and ERCC reads.,BAM files were sorted and indices were generated with samtools.,Differential gene expression was determined in R with the tximeta, SummarizedExperiment, and DESeq2 packages. The R script is available for download in this dataset.,Assembly: hg38, BDGP6.28,Supplementary files format and content: SF: salmon quantification file,Supplementary files format and content: TSV: tab-separated file
extract_protocol_ch1: 3-5*10^5 MDMs were washed once with PBS. Trifast reagent (Peqlab) was added to the cells together with an amount of 10% of Drosophila Schneider S2 cells relative to MDMs; total TRIfast volume was 500 Âµl. The pellet was fully resuspended and incubated for 5 min at RT in an 1.5 ml Eppendorf tube. 100 Âµl of chloroform were added, and the tube was shaken by hand for 15 s. After 3 min of incubation at RT, the tube was centrifuged at 12.000g at 4 degrees centigrade. The upper phase was transferred to a fresh tube, and 2 Âµl of Glycoblue (Thermo Fisher Scientific) were added followed by 250 Âµl of isopropanol. After mixing by shaking, the sample was incubated for 10 min at RT followed by centrifugation at 12.000g at 4 degrees centigrade. The supernatant was discarded, and the pellet was washed with 500 Âµl of 70% (v/v) ethanol. The supernatant was discarded, the pellet was air-dried and subsequently dissolved in 40 Âµl of water supplemented with 20 U of SUPERase-In RNase inhibitor (Thermo Fisher Scientific). A synthetic ERCC RNA spike-in mix (Thermo Fisher Scientific) was added to the sample according to the manufactur,The QuantSeq FWD Kit (Lexogen) was used according to the manufacturerâs instructions.
